thread.title_full: The Cyber Monday TV Deals Too Good To Pass Up

posts.author: i4u
posts.title: The Cyber Monday TV Deals Too Good To Pass Up
posts.text:
Sam's Club , Best Buy and Target join Walmart and Amazon in offering Cyber Monday deals Sunday. Find the best Cyber Monday 2016 deals of all shops and the best Amazon Cyber Monday deals featured in the real-time deal trackers throughout the Cyber Monday and Cyber Week sales. 
The deals on sale on Cyber Monday are not different anymore from Black Friday. The difference are retailer specific. While Amazon ( Amazon Cyber Monday Deals ) and Walmart ( Walmart Cyber Monday deals ) are continue to offer individual deals, like on Black Friday, Target is offering a 15% sitewide discount. This deal broke Target's online store last year. The retailer said that they made a lot of changes and Target.com will not fail on Cyber Monday. 
Target will also offer the 15% sitewide discount in stores, negating the meaning of Cyber Monday. Cyber Monday, a term coined by Shop.org in 2005, got established when retailers saw a trend of consumers shopping online on the Monday after Thanksgiving. Today, Cyber Monday is viewed as the online equivalent to Black Friday. 
Cyber Monday 2016 is expected to set a new record for online spending. 2016 Black Friday and Thanksgiving Day already set a new records in online spending with $3 billion and $1.93 billion respectively. Cyber Monday 2015 set a new record with $3 billion. This year Cyber Monday sales need to exceed $3 billion to beat Black Friday. 
Timing is everything in scoring the best Cyber Monday 2016 deals. To not miss a Cyber Monday deal, deal hunters can follow use on Twitter , where we notify followers about every hot Cyber Monday deal. 
Cyber Monday 2016 is on November 28. Many retailers kicked off Cyber Monday sales events right after Black Friday ends. The latest Cyber Monday 2016 deals and news are available at the Cyber Monday 2016 Hub . Buy Now on Amazon

posts.author: Jeff Beck
posts.title: [Deal Alert] Nest Cam prices fall even lower at Amazon, indoor now $127, outdoor $170
posts.text:
News 
The Nest store has some pretty sweet offers for its portfolio of products for Black Friday weekend. The Nest indoor camera is available at the very compelling price of just $149. Well, sorry if you already bought one, because Amazon just dropped the price on two different Nest camera models to the lowest level we've seen yet (Maybe you can still cancel your order?). 
The Nest indoor camera is currently on sale for $127.49 and the outdoor model is also discounted to $169.99. Those are both excellent prices for connected cameras of this quality and could be the best deals we see on them all year. In fact, the indoor models price is so good that, as of now, it is back-ordered. The good news is that it is still available to purchase as long as you are OK waiting a bit longer to receive it than the accustomed 2-day Amazon delivery. 
With prices this good, both products may go OOS soon, so don't delay if you want to pick up one, or both of these devices while they are on sale. I think I might grab an indoor camera to use as a baby monitor. If any of you readers have used one for that purpose I'd love to hear how well it works in the comments below. 
Here are the links, you know what to do with them.

posts.author: The Hill
posts.title: Amazon removes negative reviews of Megyn Kelly's memoir
posts.text:
The Hill ^ | 11/23/2016 | Brooke Seipel 
Posted on 11/27/2016 11:31:15 AM PST by bkopto 
It appears Amazon has decided to remove some negative reviews of Megyn Kelly's new autobiography, "Settle for More," after groups of pro-Donald Trump internet "trolls" decided to leave one-star reviews en masse. 
A report from Slate Tuesday showed that more than 75 percent of the book's reviews were one star, but by Wednesday morning, USA Today noted that that number had been reduced to 17 percent. (Excerpt) Read more at thehill.com ...

posts.title: Cyber Monday 2016: Best And Latest Deals Already Live - New London, CT Patch
posts.text:
Amazon Devices 
Amazon Echo, $140 — Amazon's signature Alexa voice-control device gets a $40 discount for the time being. We're also guessing that Cyber Monday will feature a lot of Alexa-only deals. Grab your Echo now so you'll be ready for those deals by Monday. 
Echo Dot, $40 — Add Alexa voice control to a room of your house for $10 off right now. At $40, this personal assistant makes for a great gift for that person on your list that you aren't quite sure what to get. 
Amazon Tap, $90 — Tap — a smaller, more portable version of Echo — is under $100. 
Fire HD 8 Tablet, $60 — One of the best tablet deals out there is as affordable as it'll ever be, at 16 GB of storage. If you want 32 GB, you'll add $30. 
Fire Tablet, $33.33 — The entry-level Fire tablet is also down to "ridiculously cheap" levels right now. 
Kindle Paperwhite, $100 — Paperwhite is probably the best bang for your buck if you're a bookworm, and you can knock $20 off of it right now. 
Kindle E-reader, $50 — Amazon's signature e-reader is just $50 in its base form. 
Fire Kids Edition, $75 — This kid-friendly bundle comes with a Fire tablet loaded with kids apps, books and movies plus a heavy-duty case to keep it safe. 
Amazon Fire TV, $75 — Amazon's Fire TV keeps getting more powerful. Now you can stream 4K Ultra HD picture quality along with all of your streaming services. 
Fitbits — Fitbit's Cyber Monday deals are live, and some of the prices are actually lower than they were on Black Friday. The bare-bones Flex is down another $10 to $59 , the powerful Charge 2 is holding steady at $129 , the stylish Alta is $15 cheaper at $84 and the Blaze smartwatch drops another $22 from Black Friday down to $127 . 
We aren't sure how long these prices will last, so go ahead and pull the trigger now if you're looking for Fitbits. 
Xbox One S 500GB Console, Minecraft Bundle, $212 — The kids will love you when they open this Xbox One bundle. Your wallet will love you when it pays just $212 for it. You can also grab a 1TB Xbox One - Battlefield bundle for $255. Both of these prices you won't see until checkout. 
PlayStation 4 Pro, 1 TB, $340 — If you're a Playstation family, you can pick up a powerful 1TB PlayStation Pro — on the high end of the PlayStation spectrum — for $340 right now (Note: you'll see the discount at checkout). This is the only PlayStation deal we're seeing right now, but will update right here if that changes. 
PlayStation 4 DualShock 4 Wireless Controller $34 — If your kids want to play their video games with their friends PlayStation 4 controllers are both $34 right now, a five-dollar drop-off from Black Friday prices. Xbox One controllers are out of stock right now , but we'll update right here as soon as they're back up. 
Anker PowerCore 20100, Ultra High Capacity Power Bank, $28 — This powerful battery pack from Anker will give you about five to seven full charges on your smartphone depending on the model. Anker's smaller model that will give you just one full charge is $12. 
VIZIO Sound Bars — Vizio's popular sound bars are extremely easy to use and can instantly add theater-level sound to your living room or bonus room. Right now, you can pick up a 38-inch model for $212 or the 40-inch for $297. 
Blue Snowball iCE Condenser Microphone, $40 — We've used Blue's Snowball microphone for podcasting and basic recording needs and couldn't be happier. At $40 right now, it's a no-brainer for anyone who needs to do any sort of voice capturing. The more powerful Blue Yeti is still going for $90 , as it was on Black Friday. Home and Kitchen 
Zinus Memory Foam 12 Inch Green Tea Mattress, $128-$262 — Add a comfy memory foam mattress to your home for the holidays right now with this deal from Zinus. It can be unnerving ordering a mattress online, but these have 4.5 stars from more than 3,000 notoriously hard-to-please Amazon reviewers. It'll also show up at your front door in two days if you have Amazon Prime. 
Just note that this is good for Sunday only and will be gone on Cyber Monday. 
Rowenta DW5080 Focus 1700-Watt Micro Steam Iron, $47 — Amazon's best-selling steam iron is marked down more than 50 percent. Note: This deal is only good Sunday. 
Hoover FH50150 Carpet Basics Power Scrub, $80 — Hoover's Power Scrub can clean your carpets and furniture in one fell swoop and is just $80 right now, an incredible price for this highly rated machine. You can also add pet stain remover for just $14 more. 
Nest Learning Thermostat, 3rd Generation, $200 — Pick up Nest's signature smart thermostat, which can work with Alexa, for $50 off right now. 
Ecobee3 Thermostat with Sensor, $199 — Ecobee's smart thermostat has many of the same features as Nest, with one difference: It comes with a sensor that sits in the middle of the room for a better temperature reading. And it will talk to your new Echo or Echo Dot . 
Instant Pot IP-LUX50 6-in-1 Programmable Pressure Cooker, $54 — There's never been a better time to buy Instant Pot's mega-popular pressure cooker. At $54, it's now $4 cheaper than it was even on Black Friday and at the lowest price we've ever seen for it. 
Oral-B Pro 5000 SmartSeries Power Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush, $60 — Oral-B's popular electric toothbrush is marked down four dollars cheaper than on Black Friday down to just $60, a killer deal for this rechargeable brush that uses Bluetooth to track your brushing habits. Just be sure to click the green "clip coupon" button before you checkout. 
Up To 75 Percent Off Coats — Winter is coming. Gear up and browse through this Gold Box Deal full of coats for men, women and kids. 
Ninja Coffee Bar Single-Serve System, $110 — Coffee-lovers will love this single-serve coffee machine that comes with a frother and five different brewing options. 
Ninja Coffee Bar Brewer, $130 — Alternatively, this brewer bundle comes with an 18oz. tumbler, Glass frother, 40-recipe cookbook, permanent filter, five paper filters, scoop, and a 43-oz. carafe. 
Canon Office and Business MX922 All-in-one Printer, $70 — Add this reliable, mobile-abled printer to your office for $70 right now. 
All prices and savings are as of publication and could change, and Patch may earn a commission on some purchased items.

thread.title: Repeated Jet Lag May Increase Liver Cancer Risk
thread.title_full: Repeated Jet Lag May Increase Liver Cancer Risk

posts.author: ians
posts.title: Repeated Jet Lag May Increase Liver Cancer Risk
posts.text:
Don't Miss: Amazon Cyber Monday 2016 Deals 
"Liver cancer is on the rise worldwide, and in human studies we have now seen that patients can progress from fatty liver disease to liver cancer without any middle steps such as cirrhosis," said lead author David Moore, Professor at Baylor College of Medicine in the US. 
The study found that chronically jet-lagged mice developed liver cancer in a very similar way as that described for obese humans. 
When we constantly travel through different time zones, work night shifts, or push ourselves to stay awake at the regular sleep time, our central circadian clock in the brain becomes chronically disrupted, the researchers said. 
"We think most people would be surprised to hear that chronic jet lag was sufficient to induce liver cancer," Moore added. 
In the study, the researchers changed the times the lights went on and off during the night each week to understand the effects of chronic jet lag in normal mice who were fed a healthy diet. 
They found that the mice gained weight and fat, and developed fatty liver disease, which progressed to chronic inflammation and eventually liver cancer in some cases. 
The jetlagged mice lost normal control of liver metabolism. This included not only the buildup of fat, but also increased production of bile acids -- acids produced by the liver to help us digest our food -- linked with liver cancer. 
Further, the jetlagged mice were also lacking in receptors -- called FXR and CAR -- that help regulate liver bile acid metabolism, which works in a similar manner in humans. 
Although the researchers did not directly study jetlag in humans. But as evidence have showed that sleep disruption increases both fatty liver disease and liver cancer risk in humans, they hypothesised that lifestyle changes that generate chronic jet lag can also disrupt the body's internal homeostasis and increase liver cancer risk in humans. 
The study appears in the journal Cancer Cell.

posts.title: Amazon Reviewers Take On Donald Trump Holiday Ornament — And Other Trump Products
posts.text:
It seems nobody is taking Donald Trump’s holiday ornament, a brass cap with gold trim and Trump’s ‘Make America Great Again’ logo emblazoned on the front, very seriously. Released this week in the Trump shop for $149 , the item is being offered for resale on Amazon at prices over $200, and while it’s not clear if anyone is actually buying it there, Amazon shoppers are definitely reviewing it.
[Image via Amazon ] It’s pretty clear that most of the reviews aren’t being posted by Donald Trump’s biggest fans. They make reference to things like Trump’s apparent support from KKK members, and the disparity between the popular and the electoral vote.
Came with an entire crate of white hood ornaments. Great bargain! Downside: My tree is now on fire.
This year it was between this ornament and another one that is less flashy, less gaudy, and just overall nicer. During our family meeting we overwhelmingly chose the other ornament but somehow we still ended up with this one. We’re not sure what happened.
Another one-star review refers to Trump’s promises to deport undocumented immigrants.
The only Christmas ornament that will try to deport your nativity scene.
Others make reference to the surfaced recording in which Trump appears to brag about sexually assaulting women — generally making use of the fact that the slang term Trump used in the recording is also used for cats.
I actually ordered the bright blue “Pantsuit Ornament,” but this is what i got instead. After several days of paralyzing shock and disappointment, some friends intervened and told me i should “make the best of it” and hang the ornament on the Christmas tree anyway. So i did. Unfortunately, within minutes the ornament’s tiny mango-hued hands began reaching out to grab my two cats as they walked by.
It’s not just the official Make America Great Again holiday ornament though — reveiwers have been having fun on other Trump merchandise as well.
The Donald Trump coffee mug, for instance, with removable toupee lid, has been reviewed by buyers who say it has an ’empty head’ or that they ‘filled it with nuts.’
[Image by Amazon ] If it’s been part of the criticism of Trump this election year, you can bet on it turning up in some of the reviews. For instance, the coffee mug has been the subject of jokes about the President Elect’s apparently changed stances on such topics as ‘ going after ‘ Hillary Clinton, and building a border wall .
Doesn’t hold water. More like a mirage…. Great from far but once you buy it, doesn’t work as promised!
…found coffee filters on the shelf above last night and I found conical white hats atop many of my coffee mugs this morning. 
On another Donald Trump holiday ornament (unlike the Make America Great Again cap, this is not an official product from the President Elect himself), reviewers warn that the ornament will make your tree lean so far to the right it snaps in half, waterboard the Joseph and Mary nativity ornament, and that it will get rid of your ‘non-white’ ornaments.
Then, of course, like on the other Trump products, there are the reviews poking milder fun at his style of speech.
This ornament is fantastic. It’s wonderful, really. I’ve had so many, many wonderful Christmas trees. Beautiful Christmas trees. The most beautiful Christmas trees in the entire world. I know how to find great Christmas trees. I do. Some of the most Christmasy, wintery, Christmas trees, believe me.
Even a Donald Trump novelty mask isn’t skipped by reviewers with a laugh in mind.
Scares children and minorities as advertised.
As for the Donald Trump holiday ornament, the Make America Great Again cap does have positive reviews and ratings, some touting positives points like collector’s value and possible future spikes in the value of gold, and others calling out detractors as crybabies and losers. However, there aren’t enough to balance the humorous and negative reviews — as of this writing, the Donald Trump holiday ornament has only a 1.5-star average rating.
[Featured Image by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images]
Amazon Reviewers Take On Donald Trump Holiday Ornament — And Other Trump Products is an article from: The Inquisitr News

posts.title: Amazon to offer 75000+ Cyber Monday deals, releases preview - NEWS10 ABC
posts.text:
Amazon to offer 75,000+ Cyber Monday deals, releases preview WFLA Staff Published: November 27, 2016, 2:27 pm Updated: Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) FILE - In this Oct. 18, 2010 file photo, an Amazon.com package awaits delivery from UPS in Palo Alto, Calif. Amazon is suing more than 1,000 people for advertising their services writing fake reviews for as little as $5 as it seeks to crack down on bogus reviews on its site. The complaint filed Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 in King County Superior Court in Seattle marks the latest effort by the online powerhouse to crack down on fraud on its site. (AP Photo/Paul Sakuma, File) 
KNOXVILLE, Tenn. ( WFLA ) – Amazon says it plans on offering more than 75,000 deals on Cyber Monday. 
The online retail giant said that customers will find new deals as often as every five minutes on toys, electronics, fashion items, and more. 
Last year on Cyber Monday, Amazon customers ordered more than 54 million items worldwide at 629 items per second. Amazon expects this year’s sales to be even higher. 
Amazon is offering a shopping app to track deals using Watch a Deal alerts which notify customers via a mobile alert when a deal is about to start. 
The deals below – and more – will be available on Cyber Monday, November 28 at http://www.amazon.com/cybermonday . 
Customers can also shop the same deals and selection while giving back to their favorite charity – just start with a smile at smile.amazon.com.

thread.title: Cloud compute pricing bakeoff: Google vs. AWS vs. Microsoft Azure - ZDNet
thread.title_full: Cloud compute pricing bakeoff: Google vs. AWS vs. Microsoft Azure - ZDNet

posts.title: Cloud compute pricing bakeoff: Google vs. AWS vs. Microsoft Azure - ZDNet
posts.text:
| Topic: Cloud 
With Amazon Web Services hosting its annual powwow this week talk about the price for performance and agility equation will be everywhere. Special Feature Cloud Computing: Moving to IaaS 
Infrastructure as a Service providers make a very compelling argument for businesses to stop running their own data centers and simply purchase server capacity on-demand and scale up and down as needed. This is our deep dive on IaaS strategy and best practices Read More 
Knowing AWS' re:Invent conference is kicking off this week, the largest cloud service provider has been busy cutting prices for various instances. Rest assured that Google and Microsoft are likely to toss in their own price cuts as AWS speaks to its base. 
But the cloud pricing equation is getting complicated for compute instances. Not so shockingly, these price discussions have to include discounts. Like everything in enterprise technology there's the street price and your price. Comparing the cloud providers on pricing is tricky given Microsoft, Google and AWS all have different approaches to discounts. 
Also: IaaS: What you need to know about pricing, options, best practices | Eight questions to ask before choosing an IaaS vendor | IaaS checklist: Best practices for picking an IaaS vendor 
Fortunately, RightScale on Monday will outline a study on cloud compute prices. Generally speaking AWS won't be your cheapest option for compute. AWS typically lands in the middle between Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud. 
The bottom line is that AWS uses reserved instances in 1-year and 3-year terms to offer discounts. Microsoft requires an enterprise agreement for its Azure discounts. Google has sustained usage discounts that are relatively easy to follow. 
Overall, RightScale found that Google will be cheapest in most scenarios because sustained usage discounts are automatically applied. Among the key takeaways: If you need solid state drive performance instead of attached storage Google will charge you a premium. Azure matches or beats AWS for on-demand pricing consistently. AWS won't be the cheapest alternative in many scenarios. Then again AWS has a bigger menu, more advanced cloud services and the customer base where it doesn't have to go crazy on pricing. AWS just has to be fair. Your results will vary based on the level of your Microsoft enterprise agreement and what reserved instances were purchased on AWS. 
Here are three slides to ponder from RightScale. 
Add it up and you'd be advised to make your own comparisons, check out RightScale's SlideShare and then crunch some numbers. In the end, enterprises may have to have all three cloud providers in their company--if only to play them off each other. ZDNet Monday Morning Opener 
The Monday Morning Opener is our opening salvo for the week in tech. Since we run a global site, this editorial publishes on Monday at 8:00am AEST in Sydney, Australia, which is 6:00pm Eastern Time on Sunday in the US. It is written by a member of ZDNet's global editorial board, which is comprised of our lead editors across Asia, Australia, Europe, and the US.

thread.title: Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad
thread.title_full: Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad

posts.author: J.T. Fellows
posts.title: Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad
posts.text:
Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad 2016-11-27T21:14:17Z Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) The priest invites an imam over for a cup of tea and meaningful conversation. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) Both men receive a package from Amazon as they find out that each bought each other knee braces. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) Both men put on their gift and can kneel for prayer pain free. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) 
(WTVM) – Online retailer Amazon hopes to bring a little joy to the world after what some would call a rough year with its new holiday advertisement. 
In the ad, which looks to bridge the gap between religions, a priest invites an imam over for a cup of tea and meaningful conversation. 
When both friends go to sit down and stand up, you can see the physical struggle of age as both clench their knees and grimace in pain 
As the imam leaves the priests’ home, both grab their phones and place an order on the Amazon app. 
Days later, both men receive a package from Amazon as they find out that each bought each other knee braces. 
Both men put on their gift and can kneel for prayer pain-free. 
Click here to watch the advertisement from Amazon , which has gotten over 1 million views on YouTube. 
Copyright 2016 WTVM . All rights reserved. Trending Stories Trending Stories More>> 9 shot, 1 killed in French Quarter mass shooting At least one person was killed early Sunday morning during a shooting in the French Quarter. (FOX 8) 
New Orleans police say at least one person is dead after at least one gunman fired shots on in the French Quarter earlier Sunday morning.

posts.author: Kathryn Vasel, CNN
posts.title: Amazon unveils Cyber Monday deals
posts.text:
Amazon unveils Cyber Monday deals By Kathryn Vasel, CNN   4:45pm 0  
NEW YORK (CNNMoney) — Black Friday sales are still going on, but Amazon has unveiled some of its deals for Cyber Monday. 
The online retailer will roll out more than 75,000 sales starting Monday and throughout the week on a variety of products, including toys, electronics, video games and books. 
While electronics tend to be big sellers on Cyber Monday, Amazon said that so far this holiday season, the "most-watched deal" has been the Mermaid Tail Blanket. 
Related: America shops: Black Friday 2016 is here 
Amazon's own products will also be on sale on Monday: The voice-controlled Echo speaker will be priced at $139.99 and the Tap Bluetooth speaker will be $89.99. Both sale prices match what the company offered as part of its Black Friday sales. 
Cyber Monday is a big sales day for Amazon. Last year, shoppers ordered more than 54 million items -- 629 per second -- on the Monday after Thanksgiving. 
Amazon Prime members, who pay $99 a year, will get early access to Lightning Deals. There will also be specific deals for shoppers using Alexa, the voice assistant in Echo. 
Here's a look on what will be on sale Monday: 
--50-inch 1080p LED TV for $145 
--50-inch 4K Ultra HD Smart TV for $249.99 
--Amazon Voyage for $169.99 
--Amazon Fire TV for $74.99 
--Sonos PLAY: 1 compact wireless speaker for $149 
--Nest Cam indoor security camera for $163.98 
--Up to 50% off select Nerf, Playskool and Play-Doh toys 
--Blendtec Total blender for $239.99 
--Up to 50% off select Callaway Golf sets

posts.text:
Black Friday itself may be over, but there are still thousands of deals to be had thanks to Best Cyber Monday Deals 2016 for Amazon. That’s right, the biggest sales event of the year continues,
Tampa, United States – November 27, 2016 /MarketersMedia/ —
The day after Thanksgiving itself might be over, however there’s no lack of arrangements still to be had because of Best Cyber Monday Deals 2016 for Amazon making now one of the best times to get astounding tech deals.
Up to 80% OFF Cyber Monday Deals
Here we clarify what is Cyber Monday, and where can get the absolute best Cyber Monday bargains in the UK now that Black Friday has finished. Additionally, read Best Cyber Monday Deals 2016 purchasing counsel and top Cyber Monday tips.
Latest Cyber Monday Deals Here
The day after Thanksgiving is over, yet this Cyber Monday and past will in any case observe a portion of the best deals we’ve seen all year as retailers proceed with their immense deal occasions for Christmas customers. There are gigantic rebates still to be had from Amazon, Argos, Currys and heaps of different retailers, offering colossal arrangements and rebates on their items because of the developing fame of Cyber Monday advancements.
The shopping extravaganza following Thanksgiving arrangements were customarily a one-day-just undertaking, however late years have been popular to the point that retailers have been regarding the entire of November as an opportunity to push Black Friday-themed bargains occasions. Presently, the fun proceeds with Cyber Monday. Here, we’ll be clarifying what Black Friday and Cyber Monday are, and investigate a portion of the best arrangements from a year ago from retailers over the UK.
Amazon’s Black Friday occasion, which is seemingly the greatest and most well known of them all, commenced on 14 November and proceeded as Black Friday Reloaded throughout the end of the week in front of Best Cyber Monday Deals 2016 huge deals occasion. Bargains incorporate Best Deals which run throughout the day and can proceed into the following day if there is stock accessible, while Lightning Deals keep running for six hours until stock runs out, some of which offer out inside minutes.
Now customers can get early access to Amazon’s Best Cyber Monday Deals 2016 Lightning Deals on the off chance that are an Amazon Prime Member. Can agree to a 30-day free trial of Amazon Prime here – now is an awesome time to do as such.
Argos has guard Black Friday and Cyber Monday bargains bonanza happening at this moment here.
Currys has additionally proceeds with its Black Friday manages a Black Tag Event with value cuts on a large number of items.
Continuously the day after the US’ Thanksgiving festivities, or the fourth Friday in November, Black Friday denote the begin of the official Christmas shopping season. It’s a day on which numerous US buyers don’t work, and when they can hope to see various rebates on items.
Customarily a US thing, Black Friday went to the UK through Amazon and Apple, and in 2016 various retailers will offer marked down items for Black Friday and the Monday that takes after, which is known as Cyber Monday since it is the busiest day for web based shopping each year, in the UK.
There are two principle schools of contemplated where the name Black Friday originates from. The primary begins from the lanes of Philadelphia, where the term was utilized to portray the overwhelming clog on the streets and shopping high roads on account of distracted deal seekers. The second clarification is that Black Friday is a day where shops records would go from being paying off debtors to being in benefit, in this way going from red to dark, subsequently the name Black Friday.

thread.title: Amazon's Most Overlooked Competitive Advantage
thread.title_full: Amazon's Most Overlooked Competitive Advantage | Fox Business

posts.author: foxnews.com
posts.title: Amazon's Most Overlooked Competitive Advantage
posts.text:
Image source: Amazon.
Continue Reading Below
A lot of investors look at Amazon.com (NASDAQ: AMZN) and they see a company with unparalleled distribution capabilities or a market-leading cloud computing service. What I see, however, is the place people go to shop online.
While that might sound completely obvious, it's an advantage that's hard for competitors to overcome. Fifty-five percent of American online shoppers begin their product search on Amazon.com, according to a recent survey from BloomReach . I'm willing to bet a large percentage of shoppers end their product search on Amazon as well.
That influx of shoppers leads to more product creators and merchants wanting to get their products on the virtual shelves of Amazon so that their items show up in shoppers' product searches. That inimitable shopper behavior is at the core of one of Amazon's three pillars: its Fulfilled by Amazon program.
More From Fool.com Motley Fool Founders Issue New Stock Buy Alert Forget GE! Heres how to play the largest growth opportunity in history Forget Apple! Heres a Better Stock to Buy He Made 21,078% Buying Amazon. Heres His New Pick Can't be beat Amazon is rapidly building out warehouses and distribution centers. Last quarter, it opened 18 new warehouses, and it's already opened five more this quarter. But even at this breakneck pace, it's competing with retailers that already have significant real estate footprints like Wal-Mart (NYSE: WMT) and Target (NYSE: TGT) . Both have taken steps to utilize their stores' footprints more effectively for fulfilling online orders.

posts.author: Richard Gao
posts.title: [Deal Alert] Save $12 on an Anker 20,100mAh battery and more as part of Amazon's Deal of the Day
posts.text:
News 
Did you pick up a new smartphone or tablet this Black Friday? If so, you may want to check out the deals that Amazon is running on some Anker products today as part of their Deal of the Day program. 
First up, the Anker Astro E1 , a 5200mAh portable battery. That may not sound like much, but it's good for between 1.5 and 2 full charges of a typical smartphone at 2A speeds. For $11.99 (about $4 cheaper than usual), you can't argue too much with the small capacity, as the small form factor is part of this battery's appeal anyway. 
Looking for a larger battery? The Anker PowerCore 20100 , which has an easily guessed 20,100mAh capacity, may be more up your alley. This thing, with its two 2.4A ports, can charge the average smartphone between 6 and 8 times. Its $27.99 price is around $12 cheaper than usual, which makes it great bang for the buck. 
If you'd rather have a quick charger, you may want to consider the poorly named " Anker Quick Charge 3.0 39W Dual USB Wall Charger, PowerPort Speed 2 ." This charger features two ports capable of Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 speeds, which will allow you to charge your shiny new smartphone as fast as humanly possible. The sale price of $19.99 is about $8 lower than usual. 
As of this article's publishing, these deals will expire in around 7 hours, so don't wait too long if you're interested. Source:

thread.title: Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad - MSNewsNow.com - Jackson, MS
thread.title_full: Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad - MSNewsNow.com - Jackson, MS

posts.author: J.T. Fellows
posts.title: Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad - MSNewsNow.com - Jackson, MS
posts.text:
Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad 2016-11-27T21:14:17Z Amazon bridges gap between religions with new holiday ad. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) The priest invites an imam over for a cup of tea and meaningful conversation. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) Both men receive a package from Amazon as they find out that each bought each other knee braces. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) Both men put on their gift and can kneel for prayer pain free. (Source: Amazon/YouTube) 
(WTVM) – Online retailer Amazon hopes to bring a little joy to the world after what some would call a rough year with its new holiday advertisement. 
In the ad, which looks to bridge the gap between religions, a priest invites an imam over for a cup of tea and meaningful conversation. 
When both friends go to sit down and stand up, you can see the physical struggle of age as both clench their knees and grimace in pain 
As the imam leaves the priests’ home, both grab their phones and place an order on the Amazon app. 
Days later, both men receive a package from Amazon as they find out that each bought each other knee braces. 
Both men put on their gift and can kneel for prayer pain-free. 
Click here to watch the advertisement from Amazon , which has gotten over 1 million views on YouTube.
